body: Yeah, I'm wondering if we shouldn't have just called `copyAttributes` here. Also note that we copy types over here: https://github.com/jamesr66a/pytorch/blob/369cd1980eb7ac74ca349c21b97040856d4cf3ea/torch/csrc/jit/passes/onnx.cpp#L80 which may be a better place for this logic, as there are multiple calls to `setOutputs`.

body_text: Yeah, I'm wondering if we shouldn't have just called copyAttributes here. Also note that we copy types over here: https://github.com/jamesr66a/pytorch/blob/369cd1980eb7ac74ca349c21b97040856d4cf3ea/torch/csrc/jit/passes/onnx.cpp#L80 which may be a better place for this logic, as there are multiple calls to setOutputs.
